archetype.archetype_expression: The forward-thinking practitioner who bridges the gap between AI hype and real application. Not an academic theorist—someone who actually uses these tools and can show you how. Excited about possibilities but grounded in practical reality. The colleague who's always finding cool AI tools and showing you how to actually use them.

soul.one_sentence: Where AI stops being buzzwords and starts being tools you actually use.
soul.expanded: The AI revolution is happening, but most coverage is either hype-driven nonsense or academic papers nobody can understand. We're different. We're practitioners first—we test, we build, we figure out what actually works. Then we show you exactly how to do it yourself. No PhD required.
soul.what_we_are: Practical AI education for everyone. Real tools, real applications, real results. Tutorials that actually work. Honest assessments of what AI can and can't do.
soul.what_we_are_not: Not hype merchants. Not academic gatekeepers. Not 'AI will take your job' fear-mongerers. Not 'AI will solve everything' utopians.

if_this_site_were.person: A 32-year-old product manager who became obsessed with AI tools and now helps their whole company work smarter. Not a developer by training but can code enough to build useful things. Always has three side projects going. Gets genuinely excited sharing discoveries but never makes you feel stupid for not knowing something.
if_this_site_were.place: A modern co-working space with good coffee and fast wifi. Whiteboards with system diagrams. Multiple monitors showing dashboards and terminals. The energy of people building things. Clean but lived-in—function over form.
if_this_site_were.time_of_day: Mid-morning—peak productivity time, fresh coffee, ready to learn and build.
if_this_site_were.season: Spring—new growth, fresh starts, emerging possibilities.
if_this_site_were.sound: Keyboard typing, notification pings (the productive kind), people excited about discoveries.
if_this_site_were.texture: Smooth screens, quality keyboards, the satisfying click of well-designed hardware.
if_this_site_were.smell: Good coffee. Clean workspace. Maybe a hint of new electronics.
if_this_site_were.taste: Quality coffee—you need fuel for learning.
if_this_site_were.music_genre: Lo-fi beats, electronic ambient—focus music for builders.
if_this_site_were.movie: The Social Network meets Her—the thrill of building something new with technology that feels magical.
if_this_site_were.book: A well-written technical tutorial that's actually engaging and gets you building immediately.

primary_persona.name: Practical Paul
primary_persona.description: A professional (any field) who knows AI is important but doesn't know where to start with actually using it. Has tried ChatGPT, maybe confused about what else is out there. Wants practical skills, not theory.
primary_persona.mindset: Eager to learn, frustrated by hype, wants real skills. Values practicality over flash. Willing to invest time to learn if the payoff is clear.
pain_points: Too much hype, hard to know what's real
Tutorials too basic or too advanced
Don't know which tools to use
Worried about being replaced by AI
Can't tell good AI content from nonsense
objections: Will this actually help my work?

secondary_persona.name: Builder Beth
secondary_persona.description: Someone with technical skills looking to integrate AI into their projects. Wants implementation details, API guides, integration tutorials.
secondary_persona.how_they_differ: Needs more technical depth, code examples, architecture patterns

tertiary_persona.name: Strategic Steve
tertiary_persona.description: Decision-maker evaluating AI for their organization. Needs to understand capabilities and limitations without getting too technical.
tertiary_persona.how_they_differ: Needs strategic overviews, use case libraries, ROI considerations

anti_persona.description: Someone looking for 'get rich quick with AI' schemes. People who want to spread AI misinformation. Those seeking to use AI for harmful purposes.
anti_persona.why_not: We don't enable scams or harm. We're about practical, ethical AI use.

visual_philosophy.overall_aesthetic: Forward-modern—clean, smart, but approachable. Tech without being intimidating.

density.description: Organized and efficient. Information-rich but scannable.
density.section_breathing: Clear sections, logical groupings, easy navigation
density.never: Never cluttered. Never overwhelming with options. Never confusing.

contrast.description: High contrast, dark mode native. The future is dark mode.
contrast.approach: Dark backgrounds with bright accents. Clean and focused.
contrast.drama_level: Medium—modern and engaging without being flashy
contrast.never: Never low-contrast trendy. Never garish. Never eye-straining.

motion.description: Sharp, purposeful, responsive. Technology should feel fast.
motion.style: Sharp easing, precise timing. No mushiness.
motion.never: Never slow. Never decorative. Never attention-seeking.

texture.never: Never organic textures. Never paper/fabric. Never retro.

shape_language.never: Never fully rounded. Never irregular. Never ornate.

depth.never: Never heavy shadows. Never extreme depth.

required_flow: Clear value proposition—practical AI, no hype
Latest updates—AI moves fast, stay current

hero_requirements.content_placement: Value prop, search, quick category access

single_posts.layout_type: Single column with sticky ToC for tutorials
single_posts.max_width: 800px for content, wider for code blocks
single_posts.sidebar_usage: Sticky ToC for long tutorials, none for short posts
single_posts.related_content_style: Next steps, related tools, progressive learning

spacing_rhythm.breathing_rule: Enough space to scan, not so much it feels slow

responsive_philosophy.mobile_approach: Fully functional on mobile—learners are everywhere

navigation.philosophy: Efficient organization—find what you need, fast

breadcrumbs.style: Clear path: Home > Tutorials > ChatGPT > Advanced Prompting

search.style: Smart search with suggestions, 'Search AI tools, tutorials, guides...'

headings.personality: Modern, technical, approachable. Forward-looking but not cold.

approved_gradients: Cyan to purple (for featured elements only)

must_include.description: Clear tag showing skill level required (Beginner/Intermediate/Advanced)
When content was last verified current

custom_ui_elements.dividers: Subtle lines or space, never decorative

writing_style.sentence_length: Clear and direct. Concise for tutorials, detailed for concepts.
writing_style.paragraph_length: Short. Scannable. Break up technical content.

voice.perspective: Second person (you) for tutorials, first person plural (we) for opinions/testing

typography_forbidden: Overly technical fonts that hurt readability
immediate_rejection_triggers: Looks like every other AI site

what_acceptable_looks_like: But generic—could be any AI site
what_perfect_looks_like: User can actually build something after visiting
Becomes a go-to resource people return to

tests.screenshot_test: Does it look like every other AI site? (Must fail)
tests.swap_test: Could this be hype-driven AI marketing? (Must fail)
tests.memory_test: Can the reader actually do something new?
tests.ten_second_test: Is it clear this is practical, not hype?

competitive_positioning.how_we_differ: More organized, more practical, more honest, better maintained
competitive_positioning.what_they_do_wrong: Too much hype, outdated quickly, scattered/unorganized
competitive_positioning.what_we_do_better: Practical focus, honest assessment, organized learning paths, current information

seo.internal_linking_strategy: Learning paths connecting related tutorials. Tools link to tutorials using them. Tutorials link to next steps.
seo.content_depth_target: Complete guides: 3000+, Tutorials: 1500-2500, Tool reviews: 1200+, Quick tips: 600-1000
